title: Best free app for intermediate astrologers.
text:
I use Time Nomad every day. This app is not for beginners! It is the only app Iâ€™ve ever seen with a Transit Timeline, or Transit Graphs, and I love the feature that allows me to select a transit and then click through to see when it began, when itâ€™s exact, and when it ends. 

The only way it could be improved is if they hired people to write descriptions of each aspect, placement, and transit. However, this is a feature of many other apps and sites, so I *can* get that information elsewhere. I consider this the best free app out there for astrology, and it satisfies the geek in me. I have purchased add-ons for this one, asteroids and progressions, but I would pay more to purchase descriptions and interpretations.

title: Love it, but my serial killer list is really long
text:
I have a strange habit where I like to enter in the data of various killers to read their birth chart. The only thing is, thereâ€™s so many of them that my people list became too cluttered that I couldnâ€™t find my family/friends, so I moved the killers all to the company list. But even after doing that, the list is HUGE. This is fine, BUT it could be better

I think a great update would be to add the option where we can create folders, rather than one huge list, so the user can make one folder titled family where they keep their family members, one titled friends where they keep their friends. More realistically in my case, I can make a folder for one time killers, one for serial killers, and (because Iâ€™m not a COMPLETE freak) one for authors, one for actors, one for musicians, etc. 

On another note, I really want the add ons...but $8 for 9 planetary bodies/asteroids is kind of steep, esp considering everything else is $4. Obviously you guys wanna make your dough, but I feel like $8 isnâ€™t worth it for only 9 extras. If you added more options to that add on, Iâ€™d buy it in a heartbeat. 

Alternatively, I think an option to buy the whole set for $20-25 (rather than $28 when buying them individually) would really push people to buying the whole set of add ons

For example, you can change orb ranges, limit which aspects are available for viewing (so if you wanted to turn off minor aspects you could), etc. 

If youâ€™re thinking about downloading - do it. Itâ€™s worth it even though Iâ€™m submitting feedback for developers. 

FEEDBACK FOR DEVELOPMENT:
- Thereâ€™s a bug where the wrong forecasting date is shown at the top when looking at future or past transits to the natal chart, and sometimes when youâ€™re viewing the natal chat +/- time
- I use this app to catalog charts so being able to group them or rearrange the order they appear on the left would be super helpful.

text:
Iâ€™d give Time Nomad a higher score IF I could read it. Because of the low contrast font color and small size type, coupled with a screen that doesnâ€™t enlarge, makes this Tome Nomad a non-visible app to my 58 year old eyes that use 1.25 magnifying reading glasses. Seems like if your going to use the type and color scheme youâ€™ve chosen you should make the screen enlargable, otherwise you are making Time Nomad useless for anyone without perfect eyesight. Looks like a good program but I canâ€™t be sure because I just canâ€™t see it.

To Gary - the developer - the solution to this problem is SIMPLE. Put all fonts in BLACK ink against a WHITE background.  Thatâ€™s all you have to do - provide contrast so the letters can be seen.  

Even if the font size is small, IF the developer provides high-contrast letters (i.e., black letters on white background) then older eyes can read your app.  Otherwise, itâ€™s not much use, if you canâ€™t see it.

title: LOOK NO FURTHER--SIX STARS. Amazing app. (Follow-up Review)
text:
Look no further, get this app. If you are a serious astrology student, this is the app you need. 

This is a follow-up to my 1st review that Apple did not let me access. 

My 1st review had 3 stars, this is an upgrade. It isn't that something goes wrong that makes an app; something WILL go wrong--it is the nature of software. It is WHAT HAPPENS when it goes wrong that makes the app, and this developer is top shelf.

------------------------------------
Apple strikes again! 
App Store not able to recognize me while logged in; and hides new reviews miles down in the list. 

I wrote a review, downgraded the star rating after paid part of app broke; and wanted to upgrade it again. If I can ever find that review again I will edit it, Time Nomad deserves a SOLID five stars.
-----------------------------------

This app is epic. Serious, albeit beginning astrology student here. This app is better than many costing $30 and up! It does require an internet connection; but the bonus is that you get very precise coordinates, and the app takes up less space on your phone, and will run a lot faster as the bulk of the work takes place on the server.

It is fast, flawless, feature-packed and comes with a great help system which is activated by clicking on the various elements such as f. example transits. 

The paid progression broke; but--this gal is an old geek, been using computers since the -80's and let me tell you; personal service like this is exceptional, and in 2018, downright unheard of. The developer personally answered my query and spent time troubleshooting my issue via e-mail. Color me IMPRESSED! While the part still isn't functional; the rest of the app still is, and I am 100% convinced it will be taken care of. 

I have therefore scrapped my plans of buying another program, and instead plan on springing for the asteroid package to make it a complete solution. 

I'd give Time Nomad six stars if I could. 

Thank you Denis!! â˜ºï¸ğŸ‘

I edited two persons, same issue â€“ and it is incremental. UTC conversion works. In short, as I use the app, it slowly goes back in time, and reading transit maps is literally a headache. title: Best App for Astrology or magical practice
text: The chart system is great, every feature seems to work.  This app is especially one of the best resources for planetary time calculation.  It allows predictive planetary time, which is a big deal for planning fortuitous times, and magical operations.  This is the only IOS app that does this to my knowledge.

title: Very well produced
text: Absolutely brilliant app, can make it give you notifications for planetary aspects and widget feature - bloody fantastic, I never rate apps but this blew me away

title: Very good app
text: Simple, efficient with a friendly interface. Good if you need astrological data. Some improvements to do on natal chart. Thx to developer

title: Awesome
text: This is a really good app for a novice of astrology like me because it shows all the descriptions you need to make out a chart. Please keep it up!

title: Amazing
text: So much information in a clean design. Pretty much perfect except that it makes me want to spend the day delving into the vast info it provides.

title: This app is amazing.
text: Super useful sine it allows you to see your own personal transits as well as save other natal charts. Well worth checking out if your into any aspects of astrology.

title: Great app
text: Love the info and layout one of my fav apps

title: The Ideal Astrology App
text: What an amazing astrology app. It was all I was looking for and a whole lot more. The new moon widget is great.

title: Great app
text:
Great looking and functional app. Lots of features to bring Astrology to life.
Great for transits.
Really nothing else on app store in its class.

Thanks

title: Great....but
text: Not the easiest app to navigate through. Give yourself time learn where everything thing is and how it all works. Wish there was a section explaining basic things...such as what the different colors mean. Other than that...it's great!

title: Love

title: Great app but something's stuck..
text:
Great app. Thumbs up for the heliocentric feature which is excellent and there isn't in any other app I used so far. But....
For several days now it has stuck and it won't calculate current day's transits. It keeps on showing August 16th and it's the 28th already...
